explanation: The stage direction 'Joseph et Victorine tombent à genoux' describes a movement of the characters Joseph and Victorine, specifically falling to their knees. This action does not involve an entrance or exit (categories 4 or 5), nor is it an act of aggression (category 1), an aside (category 2), a delivery manner (category 3), an interaction (category 6), the playing of music (category 8), a narrative description (category 9), an object manipulation (category 10), or a setting description (category 11). It fits best under the category of general character movement (category 7).
stgdir: Joseph et Victorine tombent à genoux.
